Articles.Content: I really need to know what the average seafloor depth is! However, the internet does not give me that data, could one of you guys help?
I don't think anybody's ever needed the info. http://www.kerbalmaps.com/ does give that info when you hover, so you could use it to take samples yourself.
I don't currently have access to a computer in the traditional sense. (My phone) So I can't currently do that, but later I should be able to.
Apparently the game glitches after 1000 meters below sea level and physics break down for some reason. So re-creating shipwrecks or submarine -ing might be a problem

5 hours ago, Scientia1423 said:

Apparently the game glitches after 1000 meters below sea level and physics break down for some reason. So re-creating shipwrecks or submarine -ing might be a problem

I don't think I found anything below 900m within my flight range of KSC a few weeks ago... (undersea scatter from SVT). That is pretty deep though, took a while to get down that far and lots of scope for undersea operations

3 hours ago, eddiew said:

I don't think I found anything below 900m within my flight range of KSC a few weeks ago... (undersea scatter from SVT). That is pretty deep though, took a while to get down that far and lots of scope for undersea operations

Huh, I heard from KottabosGames and from Scott Manley that the physics break down after reaching that depth.

1 hour ago, Scientia1423 said:

Huh, I heard from KottabosGames and from Scott Manley that the physics break down after reaching that depth.

900m definitely not. Unfortunately I was too stupid to leave the HUD up and record the depth properly... the only one I have is at 33m which really isn't very interesting :/

Deepest point is well over 1000m (about 1800 iirc, or maybe 1300, can't remember which).  If I get chance I'll check later,  I have a mini sub there 

And yes, below 1000m stuff settled on the seabed sinks through it on physics load.  But if you leave it and return later it gets put back to the seabed again - then sinks again etc etc. 

Edited September 9, 2016 by pandaman

3 hours ago, pandaman said:

Deepest point is well over 1000m (about 1800 iirc, or maybe 1300, can't remember which).  If I get chance I'll check later,  I have a mini sub there 

And yes, below 1000m stuff settled on the seabed sinks through it on physics load.  But if you leave it and return later it gets put back to the seabed again - then sinks again etc etc. 

Kerbal maps says 1390.9353 m

31 minutes ago, Paaaad said:

Kerbal maps says 1390.9353 m

Thanks,  I knew 1800 didn't feel right, but that's the number that was in my head.

Yeah. The seafloor goes invisible below 1000m (Which is a problem when Laythe's average is pretty deep) but I can't recall physics glitching out.

Hmm, that's weird. The spellchecker doesn't recognize "glitching" as a word.

Ok.   Just loaded up and checked my sub, it sits on the seabed at 1391m (as @Paaaad said), then falls through on activation, With any luck this will get fixed in 1.2, though it's hardly a high priority). 

I don't know where I got 1800m from, must be getting old I guess .

On ‎9‎/‎9‎/‎2016 at 10:19 AM, Scientia1423 said:

Huh, I heard from KottabosGames and from Scott Manley that the physics break down after reaching that depth.

Likely did at one point or another but in the flurry of updates got fixed or a simple complete overhaul patched it without them meaning to.

Granted, what I'd really like is to assemble a team to design the landscape, foliage, cities and... the oceanography! It would be a nice addition and honestly a simple community team that's been tasked with doing so could it and for me at least, I'd enjoy it!
